tit.e: Fudoso (a warehouse sealed after being examined of its degree of sealing)
Fudoso (a warehouse sealed after being examined of its degree of sealing)

sen.j: 不動倉（ふどうそう）とは、律令制においてイネ穀を収納した正倉が満載となった後に、国司・郡司による検封作業を経て封印された倉庫のこと。
sen.e: Fudoso warehouse is a warehouse which was sealed after being examined of its degree of sealing by the provincial governor and the local official after the content of shoso (warehouse) became full.

Fudoso warehouse was a warehouse which was sealed after being examined of its degree of sealing by the provincial governor and the local official after the content of shoso (warehouse) became full in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「律令制において」を補足しました。
sen.e: Fudoso warehouse was a warehouse which was sealed after being examined of its degree of sealing by the provincial governor and the local official after the content of shoso (warehouse) became full in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: その中身の満載となった稲穀のことは、不動穀（ふどうこく）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The rice in the husk which became full is called Fudokoku.

sen.j: 和銅元年8月10日_(旧暦)の太政官符で、稲穀の貯蔵と不動倉設置が奨励されて以来、毎年備蓄が行われて、約30年近く後天平年間田租収入の30年分余りの（田地からの年間収穫量とほぼ同一）の貯蔵が存在していたことが現存する各令制国の正税帳から推測できる。
sen.e: Since the storage of rice in the husk and the placement of Fudoso warehouse were encouraged in the documents issued from Daijokan on August 10 of the first year of Wado (old calendar), storage of rice in the husk has been carried out year after year nearly 30 years; existing records of rice tax suggest that there existed the storage approximately the same quantity of crop yields of more than 30 years from the rice field tax during the Tenpyo era.

sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Since the storage of rice in the husk and the placement of Fudoso warehouse were encouraged in the Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) on September 2, 708, storage of rice in the husk had been carried out year after year nearly 30 years; existing records of rice tax suggest that there existed the storage approximately the same quantity of crop yields of more than 30 years from the rice field tax during the Tenpyo era.

sen.j: 通常国衙・郡衙に納められた租庸調租は動用倉（どうようそう・動倉とも）に収容されて、動用穀（どうようこく）として通常あるいは非常時の出納が行われていたが、満載状態となって一定の時期を経ると、各令制国がそれぞれの判断で動用倉を封印して不動倉とした。
sen.e: So yo cho tax put in kokuga (provincial government office compounds) and gunga (office for county officials) are usually accommodated by doyoso warehouse (also called the doso warehouse) and the doyokoku were used both for regular use and for emergency use; when the doyoso warehouse became full, after a certain period of time each province made a decision and made the doyoso warehouse fudoso warehouse and sealed it.

Soyocho (a tax system, corvee) paid to kokuga (provincial government office compounds) and gunga (office for county officials) were usually stored by doyoso warehouse (also called the doso warehouse) to distribute both for regular and for emergency uses as doyokoku (rice for regular use), which was sealed by each province's decision when it became full, after a certain period of time.

sen.j: 不動倉の鑰は都の太政官に進上されて、太政官で厳重に保管された。
sen.e: The key of fudoso (a warehouse which is sealed after the content of the regular warehouse became full) was presented to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) of the capital, and it was carefully kept by Daijokan.
The key of fudoso (a warehouse sealed after the doyoso warehouse became full) was presented to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) of the capital to be securely stored.

sen.j: 開封が必要な場合には不動倉開検申請解と呼ばれる解_(公文書)を太政官に提出して許可を求め、不動開用符または不動充符と呼ばれる太政官符の交付とともに鑰の返送を得て初めて開封が行われた。
sen.e: When opening of the fudoso warehouse became necessary, each province had to submit an official application called fudoso kaiken shinseikai to Daijokan to get a permission; receiving a document called bunshokai yofu or fudo jufu issued from Daijokan along with the key, the person applied was finally able to open the fudoso warehouse.

In case the warehouse was required to be opened, each province had to submit a dajokanpu called Fudoso kaiken shinsei-ge to Daijokan for permission; then receiving a document called Fudo kaiyofu or Fudo-jufu issued from Daijokan along with the key, it was able to be opened.

sen.j: ところが、倉庫令では倉庫内の穀は一定期間ごとに中身を入れ替えて腐敗を防止する規定があるにも関わらず、不動倉の中身をむやみに動かすことが禁じられていたために、封印後はそのまま放置されて中に入っていた不動穀を腐敗してしまう事態が相次いだため、天平12年8月14日_(旧暦)（740年）には、一定年限ごとに中身を入れ替えるために太政官符と鑰の交付を受けることが命じられた。
sen.e: According to the warehouse law, the rice in the husk must be replaced in certain intervals to prevent corruption; however, each province was prohibited to move the content frequently, after sealing most of the fudoso warehouse were left alone; for this reason the rice in the husk became putrefied; this putrefaction occurred one after another; in response this situation, on August 13, in 740, the order was issued in that each province must receive the key along with an official document in certain intervals to replace the content.

However, due to the warehouse law, under which the rice in the husk was required to be replaced in certain intervals to prevent corruption, but prohibited to move the content frequently, most of the fudoso were often remained untouched after it unsealed to make the fudokoku putrefied, then to replace the content, the order was issued on September 13, 740, in that each province must be issued the key and the dajokanpu in certain intervals.

sen.j: 更に国司の引継ぎの際にも不動倉の引継ぎを巡るトラブルが続いたことから、天平宝字7年3月24日 (旧暦)の乾政官符によって、国司交替の際には必ず開封の手続を行って中身を確認するとともに中身の入れ替えを行わせた。
sen.e: Furthermore, trouble over a transfer of the fudoso warehouse continued to occur at the time when the new provincial governor tried to take up the fudoso warehouse from the old provincial governor; thereupon, official document was issued from the Daijokan that says that at the time of a transfer of the provincial governor, confirmation of the content as well as replacement of the content must be done.

Furthermore, since troubles on the fudoso warehouse occurred continuously in taking over the position of provincial governor, the kanseikanpu (another name of dajokanpu) was issued on May 15, 763, that in a transfer of the provincial governor, confirmation of the content as well as replacement of the content required to be done.

sen.j: だが、律令制の崩壊とともに不動穀の転用・流出が相次ぎ、9世紀終わり頃には有名無実化することになる。
sen.e: However, with the fall of the ritsuryo system, diversion and run off the fudoso warehouse occurred one after another, and by the end of the ninth century the fudoso warehouse became name only.

sen.j: それでも不動穀引継のための儀式は実態がないまま、国司の制度が存在していた南北朝時代_(日本)頃まで継続していたと考えられている。
sen.e: Yet it is thought that the ceremony for transfer of Fudokoku did exist although there was no existence of real warehouse until the period of the Northern and Southern Courts in which the provincial governor system still existed.
